item.title: Analysis of Japanese firms' dividend and total payout policies
item.description: The academic literature has long assumed the existence of long-term dividend payout target ratios. With the exception of a small number of surveys, there is little hard evidence on what may guide payout targets, the level and evolution of targets. We construct a novel data set that identifies management attitudes towards payout targets using text mining and natural language processing techniques. We analyse our panel of firms using cross-sectional regressions controlling for standard risk factors and other variables.

item.title: The Influence of Foreign Investors on the Japanese Stock Market
item.description:
We investigate the information content of foreign investors’ stock market trades. We analyse a 39 year sample using a consistent set of transactions and returns data. Foreign investors' trades influence the efficient price of Japanese stocks. Their trades have increasingly reflected global stock prices and the exchange rate. Global stock price information since the 2000s and exchange rate since the 2010s.

Keywords: Efficiency; Equities; Foreign investors; Information content of trade; Investor behaviour; Market microstructure

JEL classification: C32; G14; G15
